unit: Unit 6 | Inference for Categorical Data: Proportions
title: Shape of Distribution
question_text: Suppose the graduation rate for high school students in a certain state is $91\%$ . A sample survey contacts an SRS of $100$ recent high school seniors and calculates the proportion $\hat{p}$ in this sample who graduated high school. What is the shape of the sampling distribution of $\hat{p}$ ?
solution:
Since we are dealing with a sample proportion, ^ p p ^ , we can use the Large Counts Condition to tell us the shape. The only shape we would be able to prove is approximately normal .

The sampling distribution of any ^ p p ^ is approximately normal if:

n p ≥ 10 n p ≥ 10

and

n ( 1 − p ) ≥ 10 n ( 1 − p ) ≥ 10

Since our n = 100 n = 100 and p = 0.91 p = 0.91 , the inequality n ( 1 − p ) n ( 1 − p ) does not equal at least 10 10 as 100 ( 0.09 ) 100 ( 0.09 ) only equals 9 9 . Therefore, the shape of the sampling distribution is unknown.

Choice 'E" is correct.
